subject: RE: [junit] Problem running out of memory
msgSnippet: ... have you tried to allow the JVM the use more memory? (some like -Xm..., see java -?) AFAIK you can not force the GC to do real work. ... maybe look for
messageBody:
> I have created a quite extensive test suite, which generates a new
> version of the test application. Everything works great, except that
> the teardown method doesnt seem to be destroying the previous version
> of the application from the previous test run. So later on the test
> suite runs out of memory. Does anybody know how to destroy a java
> application or how to force the garbage collector to run?

have you tried to allow the JVM the use more memory?
(some like -Xm..., see java -?)

AFAIK you can not force the GC to do real work.

> the code to teardown is:
>
> public void tearDown()
> {
> gui.setVisible(false);
> gui = null;
> }

maybe look for java.awt.Window.dispose().

Bernd

> Anybody please help!!
